content: slippers and gently shape with your hands if they get misshapen you can put a plastic bag over your foot and try on the slipper over the bag while they are still wet to check for size if the slippers are taking a while to shrink one thing you can do is place them in a bowl and pour boiling water over them and then put them in the wash again this will speed up the shrinking process another optional thing you can do to help speed up felting is to hand felt them by placing the slippers in a bucket of warm water and move them around with your hands to agitate them once slippers are the desired size stuff with something like balled up plastic bags or newspaper and gently manipulate them to be a nice slipper shape the shaping part is very important to ensure you don t end up with a lumpy slipper they will dry in whatever shape you leave them in if using the rolled border shape and roll the border as desired so that the slipper will dry with the desired shape place the slippers somewhere to dry it will take a while for the outside to dry once the outside is dry remove the stuffing material from the inside to allow the inside to dry a hair dryer can be used to speed up the drying process images stitching diagram 1 in the image you can see the back portion of the slipper and the top and sole portion stitch the red line on the sole to the red line on the top and do the same with the green 2 stitch the blue line on the long side of the back piece to the blue line on the sole 3 and finally stitch the yellow line on the back piece to the yellow line on the top piece and the purple line on the back piece to the purple line on the top piece process images stitching mattress stitch finishing edge edge folded and stitched down pre-felted felting process after first wash after second wash after third and final wash stuffing and shaping after drying for 12 hours and removing the lint and pilling from the wash
